column4: I'm using gutsy. The following problem appears both in Gnome and xfce. I have 2 panels on the screen: along top and bottom edges. With compiz enabled, the titlebar of each new window I open is covered by the top panel. Solutions?
do you have ccsm installed?
I have no idea what that is. I don't have package with this name installed.
hmm. no, I didn't have it
why was compiz working without it, then?
it's just a setings manager, but install it
I did
and run it with "ccsm" and make sure that the Place Windows plugin is checked
yes it is
well that was my guess :/
but it did fix the problem, as it seems
at least, I can't reproduce it with new windows
is it a workaround, then?
is this a common problem?
nah, that should be the default, the Place Windows plugin is responsible for initial placement for all plugins
somehow, it got disabled
weird. I don't think I ever installed this program
probably just another upgrade effect
ah.. actually, compiz wasn't running. now that I've run it, the problem still exists
you can try a different placement mode (click on the place windows icon in ccsm)
nothing changes. no luck
